column3: b'The Bailey bandana is my favorite! #TeamWarren https://t.co/k9Ghli5dER'

b"Donald Trump and his team have hurt the economy, and now they can't get their stories straight on half-baked ideas to clean up the mess they caused. If they want an actual plan for how to avert another economic downturn, they should read mine. https://t.co/sU9KGAn6Rr https://t.co/IVCXhiaeQq"

b'The period after release from prison is challenging. I was honored to talk to @BetterFuturesMN about my plan to reform our criminal justice system and learn about the important work they do to help returning citizens with re-entry. https://t.co/kfAVgNbpI8'
b'@MsLisaHendricks Happy birthday, Lisa! Let\xe2\x80\x99s dream big and fight hard together so that your birthday wish comes true.'
b'@delegateguzman Persist, @DelegateGuzman!'
b'@Lollardfish I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful that Brittany and Nikki came to our St. Paul town hall!'
b'Notes from last night\xe2\x80\x99s town hall! Can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to read them. https://t.co/7MWw8L5oAj'
b'Thanks for chatting with me, Ruth! I\xe2\x80\x99m ready to work hard for the people of Minnesota. https://t.co/eeVXDJ5tiM'
b'I promised Willa\xe2\x80\x99s dad: We\xe2\x80\x99re going to fight for an America where every kid has a chance to succeed. https://t.co/K9WcmA6h9W'
b'@andrewkorsberg I loved meeting you and your whole family, Andrew! Can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to see Cora run for president one day.'

b'Let\xe2\x80\x99s hear it for Minnesota! I\xe2\x80\x99m thankful for everyone who came out to our St. Paul town hall last night. We had a lot of fun\xe2\x80\x94and took a lot of photos. https://t.co/DVWjTI4Bk6'
b'@kevinmaisto @TeamWarren Hope you had a great birthday, Kevin!'
b'@brycetache I\xe2\x80\x99m glad to have met you, Bryce! I am so grateful to be in this fight alongside you.'
b'@amandankoehler @mandammad Great meeting you both! Thank you for fighting to hold Big Ag accountable.'
b'Yes we do. Proud to fight alongside @ItsDShawna every day. https://t.co/HGGt7xWh2v'
b'We need to repeal the 1994 crime bill. It was a mistake, and the bulk of it needs to go. https://t.co/UXihPW9VJq https://t.co/9vNG9Wl9QR'

b"The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world. Our policies are tearing families apart and devastating communities\xe2\x80\x94and they aren't making us safer. I've got a plan to completely reform the criminal justice system from front to back. https://t.co/mt9LMpMSDJ"

b'If the Trump administration gets its way on this, employers could legally fire trans Americans just for being themselves. This is discrimination, plain and simple, and we\xe2\x80\x99re going to fight it with everything we\xe2\x80\x99ve got. \nhttps://t.co/78VO0SJLD5'

b"Washington is failing Native communities, and it's time to fulfill our obligations to Tribal Nations. Deeply grateful for the opportunity to speak at #NativeVote2020 yesterday. https://t.co/Cc8dG2yZ8X"
b'@bostic_rachel20 @SCforWarren Great meeting you and your sister, Rachel. Persist!'
b'@lydiakiesling Looking great!'

b'I stand with @PPact.\n\nThe Trump administration\xe2\x80\x99s gag rule is a deliberate attempt to keep providers like Planned Parenthood from serving patients\xe2\x80\x94and an attack on women with low incomes who depend on them to get the care they need. We\xe2\x80\x99ll fight this. https://t.co/9K6WJ3IhPs'

b'Our system is the result of choices we\xe2\x80\x99ve made\xe2\x80\x94choices that together stack the deck against the poor and the disadvantaged. We can create real law and order and real justice in our country by making long overdue big, structural change.'

b'The majority of people in prison will be returned to their communities. We should ensure that returning citizens have a chance to succeed, by reducing discrimination and promoting opportunity during reentry and eliminating needlessly punitive parole requirements.'

b'As we fight to end mass incarceration, we need to ensure humane conditions for those who are imprisoned. That means meeting basic human rights standards, protecting vulnerable populations, investing in rehabilitation programs, and expanding mental health and addiction treatment.'

b"The president can grant clemency and pardons herself. I'll empower a clemency board to make recommendations directly to the White House, identifying broad classes of potentially-deserving individuals for review, such as those serving mandatory minimums that should be abolished."

b"Our criminal system places enormous power in the hands of the state, and we need better checks in place to ensure that it's just: by investing in our public defenders, reining in prosecutorial abuses, and allowing those wrongfully imprisoned to challenge their conviction."

b"Officers who violate someone's constitutional rights are often shielded from civil rights lawsuits by qualified immunity. That\xe2\x80\x99s wrong\xe2\x80\x94and needs to change. When an officer abuses the law, that\xe2\x80\x99s bad for law enforcement, victims, and communities."

b'Most police officers sign up so they can protect their communities. But too many people of color have experienced trauma at the hands of law enforcement. It\xe2\x80\x99s time to change how we police: funding what works, and building trust between police and the communities they serve.'

b'We also have to stop criminalizing poverty. As president, I will fight to end cash bail and limit excessive fines and fees. There\xe2\x80\x99s no justice in imposing high, punitive financial burdens on those who are least able to bear them.'

b"Next, we have to rethink what we choose to criminalize. That starts with repealing the 1994 crime bill\xe2\x80\x94the bulk of which needs to go\xe2\x80\x94and legalizing marijuana. Overcriminalization has filled prisons and devastated communities\xe2\x80\x94and it's time for it to end."

b'Investing in public safety should mean investing in good schools, safe housing, access to mental health services and treatment for addiction, protecting LGBTQ+ Americans, and violence intervention programs diverting young people from criminal activity\xe2\x80\x94before police are involved.'

b"Let's start by reimagining how we talk about public safety. It's a false choice to suggest a tradeoff between safety and mass incarceration. Instead of putting people in prison, we should focus on services that lift people up and make our communities safer."

b"The U.S. makes up 5% of the world's population, but nearly 20% of the world's prison population. And the evidence is clear that there are structural race problems in our criminal justice system. At every level, the system disadvantages or discriminates against people of color."

b"The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world\xe2\x80\x94yet our harshly punitive system isn\xe2\x80\x99t making our communities safer. I've got a plan to make big, structural changes at every step of the criminal justice system: https://t.co/UXihPW9VJq"

b'Here\xe2\x80\x99s the bottom line: If Dimon and the Business Roundtable are serious about their statement, we need to see real action. They can start by empowering workers and supporting my Accountable Capitalism plan. https://t.co/KwTN6YPmSm'

b'Another question: Dimon and the Business Roundtable have been busy lobbying for NAFTA 2.0. Will they change their tune now and back American workers and unions who are fighting for a better agreement? https://t.co/qYYMV6jSpX'

b"Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, leads the group that put out yesterday's statement. Will he put his money where his mouth is and actually raise pay for workers instead of spending billions on stock buybacks for shareholders? https://t.co/6Fccdj1nnP"

b'A year ago, I called out CEOs and the Business Roundtable for their single-minded focus on maximizing shareholder value at the expense of workers. Looks like they finally got the memo. But without real action, their announcement is meaningless. https://t.co/x7BFpBKqwJ'
b'Thank you to everyone who came out to our St. Paul town hall this evening! Minnesota is ready to fight for big, structural change. https://t.co/zKelQ3kro8'

b'Today at the @4DirectionsVote #NativeVote2020 presidential forum, @Deb4CongressNM and I talked about our new proposal: The Honoring Promises to Native Nations Act. Our federal government owes Native communities a fighting chance to build stronger communities and brighter futures. https://t.co/5IKQtRwVPz'

b'Where our country spends its money tells you about our values. That\xe2\x80\x99s why full funding for tribal infrastructure, education, and health care is at the heart of my ideas for Indian Country. #NativeVote2020 https://t.co/OiYtVRIiXu'

b'A problem not seen is a problem not fixed. We must raise awareness and tackle the ongoing epidemic of missing and murdered indigenous women. My administration will launch an unprecedented initiative to collect data, empower Tribal Nations, and address this crisis. #NativeVote2020'
b'Proud to fight alongside you, @Deb4CongressNM! https://t.co/o76gxkX7eH'

b'Our federal government must recognize its ongoing failure to honor its trust and treaty obligations to Tribal Nations. Proud to work alongside @Deb4CongressNM on a proposal to uphold the federal government\xe2\x80\x99s promises to Tribal Nations and empower Native communities. https://t.co/lpWRvJBVRn'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m deeply grateful for the opportunity to participate in @4DirectionsVote\xe2\x80\x99s #NativeVote2020 forum this morning. It\xe2\x80\x99s time for Tribal Nations to have the resources they need to see the prosperity they deserve. https://t.co/e0Xp8hDZ5R'

b'Glad to see some justice for Eric Garner and his family. But Daniel Pantaleo should have been fired a long time ago. And our criminal justice system needs big, structural change. https://t.co/VqSW6q8sT7'

b"I met with Frank LaMere's family before today\xe2\x80\x99s Native American Presidential Forum. I first met Frank when I launched my campaign, and I'm proud to talk today about how we can carry on his legacy by strengthening the relationship between the federal government and Tribal Nations. https://t.co/Q28bXzfWLM"
b'I love calling grassroots supporters to thank them for chipping in to my campaign. Will you chip in $3 or whatever you can? I just might call you to say thanks. https://t.co/IsZTlgO4DP'

b'The CFPB student loan ombudsman is supposed to protect students from getting cheated. But the Trump administration\xe2\x80\x99s pick for the job is an executive at a student loan servicer that got over 9,000 complaints from borrowers. In my administration, the CFPB will work for the people. https://t.co/vrOB7h3EDU'
b'Let\xe2\x80\x99s hear it for America\xe2\x80\x99s public school teachers! https://t.co/Z2LjM04WI1'
b'These guys are looking good in Columbia, SC. https://t.co/HobC3TVbAr'
b'@clairebarry Congratulations on your final treatment, Claire. Your strength inspires me. Persist!'

b'Yesterday, I talked with @BlackChurchPac about how the Black maternal mortality crisis is threatening the lives of Black women. I\xe2\x80\x99m way past \xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s raise awareness about this problem.\xe2\x80\x9d We have to do something about it. https://t.co/tgvTAIpErA'

b'I took on giant banks, and I beat them.
I took on Wall Street C.E.O.s, and I beat them.
I took on a popular Republican incumbent senator, and I beat him.

When we fight, we win\xe2\x80\x94and I\xe2\x80\x99m not afraid of a fight.'
b'Woo-hoo! See you in September, @MassDems! https://t.co/UYhsJj6JTD'
b'This is wonderful. Thank you so much, @erindraws! https://t.co/snNCLSAX9W'
b'Ayanna and I are running for president, because that\xe2\x80\x99s what girls do. https://t.co/xLHCY21M3D'
b'When workers fight, workers win. I\xe2\x80\x99m behind @Culinary226 all the way. https://t.co/HkfcOFGFn8'
b'Thank you Aiken, South Carolina! I\xe2\x80\x99m ready to fight alongside you until every family in this country has the opportunity to succeed. https://t.co/NDu0llmfdc'

b'My plans aren\xe2\x80\x99t just lists of policy ideas\xe2\x80\x94they\xe2\x80\x99re a statement of my values. Thank you to @blackchurchpac for inviting me to talk about how we can make big, structural change together. https://t.co/YAstwerEhv'

b'The Line 3 pipeline would threaten Minnesota\xe2\x80\x99s public waters, lands, and agricultural areas important to several Tribal Nations. I\xe2\x80\x99m with @MN_350 and Minnesota organizers fighting to #StopLine3 and protect our environment.'

b"We're having these important conversations everywhere\xe2\x80\x94in parks, in grocery stores, on farms and at the corner store! And now we're making sure you can organize everywhere, too. I hope you'll sign up for this training and join us on Reach! https://t.co/yQSjZaJmtA"

b'Wells Fargo forced Xavier to close out his accounts, yet he was still hit with over $1,000 worth of overdraft fees. It\xe2\x80\x99s not right. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been fighting for years to hold Wells Fargo accountable, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to stop until they clean up their act. https://t.co/u3Kh9Yzjgw'
b"I'm speaking live at @blackchurchpac now about the big, structural change we're fighting for. Tune in! https://t.co/LitSnLlCTA"
b'It\xe2\x80\x99s an honor to fight alongside @GabbyGiffords and @GiffordsCourage to end gun violence. https://t.co/ODe0nlhtxQ'
b'With a North Country view like this, you\xe2\x80\x99d move fast too. https://t.co/rkYEx8YrcK'
b'We\xe2\x80\x99re in this fight together\xe2\x80\x94for our children, for our communities, and for our future. https://t.co/tKV0Bk38kL'

b'Since an extreme Ohio law eliminating funding for @PPFA went into effect, the system has struggled to keep up, putting women\xe2\x80\x99s health at risk.

This is what\xe2\x80\x99s at stake across the country. A Warren administration will protect women\xe2\x80\x99s health.
https://t.co/58q7BoJqeW'
b'@somelikeitcole You\xe2\x80\x99ve got this. Good luck!'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to team up with @Deb4CongressNM on our new bill to uphold our responsibilities to Tribal Nations and indigenous peoples and provide them with predictable, guaranteed funding. https://t.co/ok2QnNgM1C'
b'Proud to fight alongside @PaaWeeRivera every day. https://t.co/qlp4L8TCid'

b'We must stand united with Tribal Nations and indigenous peoples to ensure that Native voices are heard and their rights are respected. With real structural change, we can write a new story. \nhttps://t.co/vKQaJ8L9mo'
b'@Deb4CongressNM Thank you, @Deb4CongressNM. It\xe2\x80\x99s an honor to fight alongside you.'

b'To everyone who gives me letters at town halls: Thank you! These came from the people of Nevada after our Henderson town hall. I love reading about what gets you in this fight\xe2\x80\x94we\xe2\x80\x99re in it together. https://t.co/gODUAKWeRJ'

b'I got a lot of letters to read at our first-ever town hall in Arizona. Your stories inspire me to keep fighting. And yes, Casey: I\xe2\x80\x99ll give Bailey an extra pet for you! https://t.co/ygmF8YO8HH'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve fought for a brighter future for Tribal Nations during my time in the Senate and I\xe2\x80\x99m proud to work with @Deb4CongressNM on our new bill in Congress. And when we win the White House, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be committed to achieving that future as President of the United States.'

b'Right-wing courts have ruled that religious freedom laws allow corporations to deny employees birth control, but don\xe2\x80\x99t protect tribes that object to dumping sewage water on sacred sites. Absurd. Congress should pass a new law protecting tribal religious interests in sacred sites.'

b'When tribal concerns have conflicted with corporate profits or resource extraction, tribes lose. This has to change. When I\xe2\x80\x99m president, energy projects that impact Indian Country won\xe2\x80\x99t proceed without consent. That means revoking Trump\xe2\x80\x99s KeystoneXL and DAPL permits.'

b'In 2013, the Violence Against Women Act crucially recognized some criminal jurisdiction by Tribal Nations, and I support reauthorizing and building on it. But we need to go further and I support a full Oliphant fix.'

b'Washington has refused to fully respect tribal sovereignty in criminal justice matters. This has deprived countless crime victims the opportunity to get justice. And it has fed the ongoing epidemic of missing and murdered indigenous women. This must change. #MMIW'

b"Funding critical programs for Indian Country isn't optional. It's required to fulfill the United States\xe2\x80\x99 trust and treaty obligations. So @Deb4CongressNM and I have teamed up on writing a bill to ensure predictable, guaranteed funding to Tribal Nations and indigenous peoples."

b"Washington is failing Native communities, and it's time to fulfill our obligations to Tribal Nations. Today I\xe2\x80\x99m announcing ideas to ensure that tribal sovereignty and our trust and treaty obligations are binding legal and moral principles\xe2\x80\x94not just slogans. https://t.co/JT3WA6uMwu"

b'Last month, the FTC tweeted and advertised that the nearly 150 million Americans who had their data exposed in the @Equifax breach were eligible for $125 each in compensation.\n\nNow they\xe2\x80\x99re saying, \xe2\x80\x9cJust kidding!\xe2\x80\x9d I\xe2\x80\x99m demanding answers. https://t.co/mAB8LaK4H1'
b'My heart breaks for Tracy Single and her loved ones. This is an escalating crisis\xe2\x80\x94and we need to treat it like one. https://t.co/HVRucm62Rb'

b'Our Grassroots Donor Wall is almost done! Every sticker has the names of Americans who\xe2\x80\x99ve chipped in to help build our movement. I\xe2\x80\x99m proud of this 100% grassroots-funded campaign! There\xe2\x80\x99s still time for your name to be included\xe2\x80\x94will you donate $3 now? https://t.co/uEEpunJVeF https://t.co/TEDDGYB0zV'

b'Eight towns, four days, one RV\xe2\x80\x94and lots of terrific people and delicious food at the @IowaStateFair! Iowans are fired up to make real change in 2020, and it inspires me down to my bones. Here\xe2\x80\x99s a behind-the-scenes look at our week in Iowa. https://t.co/5a5eCl4fiv'

b'At our Wolfeboro house party last night, I listened to grassroots supporters explain why they\xe2\x80\x99re in this fight.\n\nOne thing\xe2\x80\x99s clear: People are determined to win in 2020 and make our government work for the people! https://t.co/MU0xZlztqL'

b'I love the North Country! Grateful to everyone who came out to our Franconia town hall yesterday. From ending the opioid epidemic to leveling the playing field for rural workers, I\xe2\x80\x99m in this fight for the people of New Hampshire. https://t.co/oVXckRbBF0'

b'Heartsick to hear that anti-LGBTQ+ violence increased during Pride Month. Hate and homophobia should have no place here in America. Now is the time to get in this fight for a country where LGBTQ+ Americans can live without fear.\nhttps://t.co/pKlYrMS1ie'
b'@theglassfish13 @PhilipRucker @damianpaletta You bet I do. Here it is: https://t.co/P1fIio6vUG'
b'@DanielBiss I\xe2\x80\x99m humbled and grateful for your support, @DanielBiss! Welcome to @TeamWarren.'

b'This is a crucial moment in the fight for workers in this country, and it\xe2\x80\x99s time for us to show whose side we\xe2\x80\x99re on. All Democrats need to stand up and say\xe2\x80\x94without dodging or weaving\xe2\x80\x94we support AB 5 and back full employee status for gig workers. https://t.co/zzTDFiEStH'
b'@TracyRamosRI @TeamWarren @RIforWarren @WorkingFamilies @ri_wfp It was great meeting you, Tracy. Thank you for being in this fight!'

b'First Disney acquired 21st Century Fox.

Now CBS and Viacom are merging. 

Consolidation raises serious concerns for consumers, employees, and the entire sector. The Department of Justice should be paying close attention. https://t.co/weQGTRL1ga'

b'It was inspiring to see @Hickenlooper\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to bettering our country during his campaign. I\xe2\x80\x99m looking forward to fighting alongside him as we work to elect Democrats up and down the ballot in 2020. https://t.co/gBXikfXaWh'

b"Activists, organizers, and community leaders are fighting tirelessly to end gun violence in their communities. We need to build on that momentum to tackle this epidemic head on. From executive action to comprehensive legislation to ending the filibuster\xe2\x80\x94I've got a plan for that. https://t.co/qOf6RNgtMI"

b"Israel doesn't advance its case as a tolerant democracy or unwavering US ally by barring elected members of Congress from visiting because of their political views. This would be a shameful, unprecedented move. I urge Israel\xe2\x80\x99s government to allow @IlhanMN and @RashidaTlaib entry."

b"I'm heartsick for the Philadelphia officers and their loved ones, and grateful for the brave first responders helping people get to safety.\n\nWe don't have to live like this. We must pass gun reform laws to end the gun violence epidemic\xe2\x80\x94now. https://t.co/r0OKa1tVnc"

b"The warning signs for another recession are flashing. We need to pay attention and act now, while we still have time to avert a downturn. I'm calling on Congress and regulators to take action before families lose big\xe2\x80\x94again. https://t.co/cglzQUWDX4"

b'I stand with airport catering workers at @DFWAirport and across the country who are fighting for a living wage. When workers fight, workers win\xe2\x80\x94and we won\xe2\x80\x99t stop making our voices heard until #1Job is enough.'

b'Steve King must resign. His latest comment is a disgusting attack on victims of sexual assault. The people of #IA04 deserve better. We must work together to elect @JDScholten in 2020. https://t.co/y5QDB4ToHc'

b"Thank you to the @WorkingFamilies Party for coming by our campaign headquarters yesterday! I was proud to partner with you to fight for the @CFPB, and I'm proud to keep fighting alongside you for big structural change in 2020! https://t.co/TmOe2bejfg"

b'For decades, Washington has done the bidding of giant multinational corporations that have no loyalty to American workers like Kim and Bella. They deserve a government that\xe2\x80\x99s on their side.\n\nAs president, I\xe2\x80\x99ll use every tool available to defend and create American jobs. https://t.co/PcJGOc3Zkg'

b'The Trump administration is making it easier to remove protections for endangered species. We have a moral responsibility to protect these vulnerable species and our environment. My administration will undo this disastrous move. https://t.co/6f0FockEz2'

b'My plan for a new farm economy tackles this ugly history and levels the playing field for farmers of color. As president, I\xe2\x80\x99ll end the policies that have perpetuated this dispossession and strengthen oversight of USDA to root out discrimination for good. https://t.co/Qvqmx7oLfS'

b'Farmers of color have experienced a long history of discrimination. From 1910 to 1997, Black farmers were stripped of 90% of their land\xe2\x80\x94a staggering loss and a major contribution to the racial wealth gap. https://t.co/6MBYWVxsI8'
b'One way we can break the NRA\xe2\x80\x99s stranglehold on Congress? Eliminate the filibuster. Our country should no longer be held hostage by a small group of well-financed extremists.'

b'"Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free."\n\nOur values are etched in stone on the Statue of Liberty. They will not be replaced. And I will fight for those values and for our immigrant communities. https://t.co/6P4ib6A0zp'

b'Student loan debt is crushing hardworking Americans like Danielle.\n\nThat\xe2\x80\x99s why I\xe2\x80\x99m calling for something truly transformational: Universal free public college and cancelation of student loan debt for 95% of Americans who carry it. https://t.co/dUE7lg67rc'
b'@MikeforIllinois Grateful for your support, Mike! We\xe2\x80\x99re in this fight together.'

b'Cherith is an Okie educator who teaches AP English Literature. She chipped in to my campaign because she\xe2\x80\x99s in this fight with me to end gun violence, and to fix our broken education and immigration systems. I\xe2\x80\x99m deeply grateful for your support, Cherith! https://t.co/JNR27s5d9w'

b'Person by person, dollar by dollar, we can win with a 100% grassroots movement: No federal lobbyists, no fundraisers with mega-donors, no money from PACs of any kind.\n\nWill you chip in now to keep up the momentum?https://t.co/Wv4oI8gDQU https://t.co/JP278vo9f2'

b'Everyone should be able to access high-quality, affordable, gender-affirming health care. But the Trump administration is trying to roll back important protections for trans Americans. Help fight back by leaving a comment for HHS in protest: https://t.co/pKDcOqbsc7'
b'Strawberries are in season and my grandson\xe2\x80\x99s in town\xe2\x80\x94that means strawberry shortcake! https://t.co/sZNfWnqxmy'

b'The Walmart heirs make $4 million an hour.

A new Walmart associate makes $11 an hour.

My two-cent wealth tax on families like the Waltons would help level the playing field for working families and rebuild the middle class. https://t.co/2nN5CBmECu'
b'@chasevp_15 @IAforWarren @TeamWarren @ElainaKatz It was an honor to meet you, Chase! Keep dreaming big and fighting hard.'
b'Got some lemonade at the @IowaStateFair! https://t.co/XZwedYmWrP'

b'This is a big win for @GavinGrimmVA and trans Americans across the country. When we fight, we win\xe2\x80\x94and we won\xe2\x80\x99t stop fighting until all trans people can live without fear or discrimination. https://t.co/LFUGMrZ7dW'

b"Trump\xe2\x80\x99s #PublicCharge policy makes it harder for immigrants who rely on government services to get permanent legal status. Families shouldn't be forced to choose between staying in our country & having access to basic health care & housing. As president, I'd overturn this rule. https://t.co/1kTafAWzrc"

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re going to win in 2020 by getting organized at the grassroots level\xe2\x80\x94like at our house party in Des Moines on Sunday. Democracy starts in our backyards! https://t.co/atiuIgLkP9'
b'Ready to talk with @WorkingFamilies tomorrow about how we can rebuild the middle class and make our government work for the people. https://t.co/mD5p5Z4YYB'

b'The people of Hong Kong are making clear that they will not tolerate repression, and their movement affirms: The power is with the people. They deserve our support and the support of the world. https://t.co/Ap0OQSsN0N'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99m grateful to be in this fight alongside you, @SophiaBush! We\xe2\x80\x99re going to make our government responsive to the will of the people, not a handful of corrupt extremists. https://t.co/BXTUwmrWte'
b"Two years ago, white supremacy left another ugly mark on our history in #Charlottesville. We won't forget\xe2\x80\x94and we'll continue to fight hate wherever it appears."
b'Making plans! https://t.co/d2qC3SbEbD'
b'I loved meeting Masada and her family! Motion sickness is no fun for anyone\xe2\x80\x94mom or kid. It happens to the best of us. https://t.co/JSkUZEKvsP'
b'Bruce and I wish all Muslims celebrating #EidAlAdha a good holiday. Eid Mubarak!'

b'Mass shootings capture our attention, but they\xe2\x80\x99re just the tip of the iceberg of gun violence in America. Every day, we lose one hundred Americans to gun violence, with countless more injured and traumatized. My plan makes big changes to address all kinds of gun violence. https://t.co/2IgQZRhNty'
b'In just a few minutes, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be at the #GunSenseForum talking about how we can address the gun violence epidemic head on. I hope you\xe2\x80\x99ll tune in. https://t.co/MbcjOsKLV1'

b"The dialogue about gun violence in America is shifting, thanks to the work of activists, organizers, community leaders, and survivors. It's time to turn our heartbreak and anger into action, and take power from the NRA and corrupt lawmakers and return it to the people."

b"And we'll revisit this legislation every year\xe2\x80\x94adding new ideas and tweaking existing ones\xe2\x80\x94to keep reducing the number of gun deaths in America. My budget will invest $100 million for DOJ and HHS to study gun violence, evaluate the reforms we pass, and suggest new ones."

b'We have to chart a new path, and that starts with investing in evidence-based community violence intervention designed to stop gun violence before it occurs. As president, I\xe2\x80\x99ll establish a grant program to invest in and pilot intervention programs at scale.'

b'Black and Latinx Americans have borne the brunt of the gun violence tragedy. But after being traumatized by gun violence, these communities have been doubly victimized by increased policing and strict sentencing laws.'

b'In addition to ending the special legal immunity gun manufacturers have now, Congress should hold manufacturers strictly liable for gun-related injuries and give victims of gun violence a private right of action to recover compensatory damages from manufacturers.'

b"This legislation will ensure that safe, responsible ownership is the standard for everyone who chooses to own a gun. We'll create a federal licensing system, require universal background checks, establish a real waiting period, and cap firearms purchases."
b'I will send Congress comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation and sign it into law within my first 100 days.'

b'My administration will also protect survivors of domestic abuse by closing the "boyfriend loophole." And we\'ll reverse the Trump administration\'s efforts to weaken gun safety, including rules that enabled 3-D printed guns and make it easier to create untraceable weapons.'

b"We'll require background checks for the vast majority of private gun sales, including at gun shows and online. We'll extend the existing requirements on reporting bulk gun sales. And we'll raise the minimum age for purchasing a gun."

b'From the White House, I will take executive action to rein in an out-of-control gun industry. Gun manufacturers make billions by knowingly selling deadly products, and it\xe2\x80\x99s time to hold gun dealers and manufacturers accountable for the violence promoted by these products.'

b'In 2017, almost 40,000 people died from guns in the U.S. My goal is to reduce that number by 80%. We\xe2\x80\x99ll start with solutions we believe will work. We\xe2\x80\x99ll update those solutions based on new research\xe2\x80\x94and stop corrupt extremists from blocking action by ending the filibuster.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s easy to despair when our government refuses to act. But we are not incapable of solving big problems. Over fifty years ago, we took big steps to make our cars safer and since then, we reduced per-mile driving deaths by almost 80% and prevented 3.5 million automobile deaths.'

b'The statistics are horrifying. Our firearm homicide rate is 25x higher than other comparable countries. Our firearm suicide rate is nearly 10x higher. Women are 21x more likely to be shot to death\xe2\x80\x94most killed by an intimate partner. 21 children and teenagers are shot every day.'

b'Gun violence is a public health crisis. That\xe2\x80\x99s why I have a comprehensive gun violence prevention plan\xe2\x80\x94a plan to make big, structural changes to end the NRA and corrupt lawmakers\xe2\x80\x99 ability to block our government from defending the lives of our people. https://t.co/fcDY6hZzdI'

b'Farms are being crushed by failed Washington policies and giant agribusinesses, and many rural communities lack access to health care and fast, reliable internet. Our rural communities are being cut off from opportunities to thrive, and I have a plan to fix it. https://t.co/xDdX4P3oM0'

b'I want Washington to work for communities all over the country\xe2\x80\x94and make sure every community has the resources it needs to thrive. Together, we can make big improvements in the lives of rural Americans.'
b'Agriculture has become one of the biggest polluters in our economy, thanks to decades of failed policy. By paying farmers to fight climate change and investing in R&D we can tackle climate change.'

b"I have plans that will help bring affordable housing, child care, and accessible banking to rural communities. My new approach to trade policy will make sure we're keeping good jobs here in America and giving rural communities a voice in trade negotiations."

b'A whole bunch of my other plans will help rural communities, too. My plan to cancel student loan debt and provide free public college will help young people build a future in rural communities, instead of driving them to cities to find a job that can pay down their debt.'

b"Here\xe2\x80\x99s my new approach: Guaranteeing farmers a fair price\xe2\x80\x94raising farm incomes and reducing taxpayer expenses. We'll pay farmers for sustainable farming that protects our environment and provide consumers with affordable, local food. https://t.co/B9Qfun34Fl"

b"Finally, I've got a plan to overhaul our country's failed approach to the farm economy. For decades, government policy has subsidized industrial agriculture at taxpayers' expense while driving environmentally unsustainable farming practices and starving farmers."

b"This ends when I\xe2\x80\x99m president. I'll create a public option for broadband and make sure every home has affordable high-speed internet. I'll crack down on anti-competitive practices and appoint FCC Commissioners who'll restore net neutrality and provide open access to the internet."

b'One of the best tools to expand access to health care\xe2\x80\x94and unlock other economic opportunities\xe2\x80\x94is high-speed internet. But big broadband companies exclude entire communities\xe2\x80\x94especially tribal communities and communities of color\xe2\x80\x94from fast, reliable internet access.'

b"I'll also tackle consolidation in health care. If a proposed merger is a first step to closing hospitals or slashing basic services, then a Warren administration will block it. And I'll invest more resources in community health centers and closing today\xe2\x80\x99s rural doctor shortage."

b"My plan starts with protecting access to health care in rural communities, which are rapidly losing access to basic services. That's why I support #MedicareForAll\xe2\x80\x94and why I'll increase Medicare reimbursement rates to help rural hospitals stay afloat."

b"Everyone should have the opportunity to build a good life wherever they live. But as giant corporations and Washington keep cutting off opportunities for huge parts of the country, the shot to succeed gets further out of reach for rural families. I've got a plan to fix that."

b'.@TheRevAl has dedicated his life to the fight for justice for all. No amount of racist tweets from the man in the White House will erase that\xe2\x80\x94and we must not let them divide us. I stand with my friend Al Sharpton in calling out these ongoing attacks on people of color.'

b'Trade can be a powerful tool. My plan represents a new approach\xe2\x80\x94one that uses America\xe2\x80\x99s leverage to boost American workers and raise the global standard of living. The president has a lot of authority to remake trade policy herself. When elected, I intend to use it.'

b"I\xe2\x80\x99ll end \xe2\x80\x9cInvestor-State Dispute Settlement\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x94the favorable enforcement we offer corporations which they've used to undermine laws that benefit workers & families (like minimum wage increases). And I\xe2\x80\x99ll create a new, stronger approach to enforcing labor & environmental standards."

b"Finally, our approach to enforcing trade deals is driving down standards worldwide. We offer corporations fast and powerful methods to enforce the provisions that benefit them, but make it nearly impossible to enforce labor and environmental protections. It's time to change that."

b"I'll make combating climate change a key focus of our trade deals\xe2\x80\x94and make sure America lives up to the same standards we hold other countries to. I'll require countries we negotiate trade deals with to comply with the Paris Climate accord and end fossil fuel subsidies."

b"I'll also go further to make sure our trade deals ensure consumer safety & protect America's family farms. And I'll fight to bring down the costs of prescription drugs here & around the world by supporting price controls & seeking out opportunities to reduce exclusivity periods."

b"I'll establish a set of standards that countries must meet as a precondition for any trade agreement: covering labor rights, human rights, religious freedom, human trafficking, protecting the environment, currency practices, and combating tax evasion and bribery."

b"For too long, we've made trade deals with countries with abysmal records on labor, environmental issues, and human rights. They get concrete access to the American market while we get vague commitments to do better\xe2\x80\x94which we hardly enforce. This must end."

b"Our trade negotiations give special access to corporate interests before the agreement is rushed through Congress. I'll end this undemocratic, corrupt practice and negotiate and approve trade deals through a transparent process that offers the public a real chance to shape them."

b"My plan is a whole new approach to trade that will transform every aspect of our current process, from how we negotiate deals, to the negotiating objectives we pursue, to the way we enforce agreements. This isn\xe2\x80\x99t about tough talk\xe2\x80\x94it's about big, structural change."

b'America has enormous leverage in trade negotiations. I won\xe2\x80\x99t hand that leverage to corporations to boost their own profits\xe2\x80\x94I\xe2\x80\x99ll use it to create and defend good American jobs, raise wages, fight climate change, lower drug prices, and raise living standards worldwide.'

b"For decades, America\xe2\x80\x99s trade policy has put the profits of big multinational corporations ahead of American workers, farmers, and the environment. I have a new approach: Trade on our terms and only when it benefits American families. Here's my plan. https://t.co/M0ILIV637H"

b'The warning lights are flashing. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s this year or next year, the odds of another economic downturn are high. This time, though, we can head it off. Congress and regulators should act immediately.'

b'With an economy this vulnerable, we need to reduce the odds of the potential shocks that can send us into another downturn. That means Congress should eliminate the debt ceiling & the Trump administration should replace its trade-war-by-tweet with China with a coherent strategy.'

b'We need to strengthen manufacturing by investing in it instead of undercutting it. My Green Manufacturing plan will invest $2 trillion in American green research, manufacturing, and exporting over the next decade, creating more than a million new American jobs.'

b'Next, we have to tackle corporate debt. After the 2008 crisis, Congress created the Financial Stability Oversight Council to monitor market risks. But the Trump-era FSOC is falling down on the job. The FSOC should meet to discuss these risks and announce a plan to address them.'

b'First, we can reduce household debt by raising wages and bringing down household costs. My plans tackle both sides of this problem, from raising the minimum wage to $15 to canceling student debt and making housing more affordable: https://t.co/QQ7FPYg2PP'

b"The good news is that we have the chance to head off a crisis, just like we had the chance to head it off in 2008, if we take bold action now to address the underlying problems in our economy. Here's what we need to do:"

b"Our country\xe2\x80\x99s economic foundation is fragile, and a single shock could bring it all down. Trump's reckless behavior makes that shock more likely. Financial markets and experts agree: We face a serious risk of another recession by the end of 2021\xe2\x80\x94maybe even by the end of 2020."

b'Despite Donald Trump\xe2\x80\x99s promises of a manufacturing \xe2\x80\x9crenaissance,\xe2\x80\x9d the country is now in a manufacturing recession. For the first time ever, the hourly wage for manufacturing workers has dropped below the national average.'

b'Corporations are deeply in debt and taking risky loans, spreading that risk throughout our financial system. These high-risk loans look a lot like pre-2008 sub-prime mortgages: poorly underwritten and with minimal protections, packaged up and sold to investors.'

b"I know it sounds stark, but here's what I see today: Families are taking on more debt than ever, thanks to a generation of stagnant wages and rising costs. Student debt has more than doubled since 2008. More than 30% of American adults have debts in collection right now."

b'I warned about an economic crash years before the 2008 crisis, but the people in power wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t listen. Now I\xe2\x80\x99m seeing serious warning signs again\xe2\x80\x94and I\xe2\x80\x99m calling for action before another crisis costs America\xe2\x80\x99s families their homes, jobs, and savings. https://t.co/sU9KGAn6Rr'

b"Letting financial firms run wild is undermining our economy. I am done with Washington ignoring the evidence and acting as if boosting Wall Street helps families. It's time to stop the looting, boost wages, grow our economy, and rein in Wall Street."

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve spent a lot of my career studying how financial firms make money by tricking and trapping families. And after I proposed a new federal agency to protect consumers, I spent nearly a year setting up the @CFPB and helping write new rules to crack down on financial scams.'

b'Finally, Wall Street sucks money away from companies that need it to grow. My Accountable Capitalism Act would end big companies catering to the short-term interests of Wall Street and let our companies focus on long-term growth and their obligations to workers.'

b"Too many families face a choice of paying a late fee on their bills, an overdraft fee to the bank, or a sky-high interest rate to a payday lender while waiting on checks. The government should adopt real-time payment technology so families don't have to wait for checks to clear."

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ve spent years advocating for postal banking\xe2\x80\x94allowing the United States Postal Service to partner with local community banks and credit unions to provide access to low-cost, basic banking services. As President, I\xe2\x80\x99ll make it happen by appointing people committed to the cause.'

b"It's also time to push our financial system back to its core purpose\xe2\x80\x94giving people a place to put their money & connecting savers with borrowers. Our system doesn\xe2\x80\x99t serve a huge slice of the country: 25% of American households don\xe2\x80\x99t have adequate access to a simple bank account."

b"And we need to end the system where bankers can make huge bonuses if risky bets pay off but lose nothing if they fail. I'll appoint regulators who will impose tough new rules to rein in banker pay."
b'First, we should enact my 21st Century Glass-Steagall Act, which rebuilds the wall between commercial and investment banks and ends taxpayer subsidies for excessive risk-taking and speculation.'

b'Next, my plan would address the incentives that fuel useless speculation that can make bankers rich but undermines the rest of the economy. Washington has encouraged this speculation with giveaways, subsidies, and lax rules. I want to end these practices immediately.'

b"My plan starts by ending this looting and fundamentally changing the industry. Private equity firms will only make money if the company succeeds. And if they make bad investments, they'll be held accountable instead of walking away with millions."

b"Just look at the private equity industry. They buy companies and bleed them dry. And when the company fails, the Wall Street guys walk away with millions while workers are left holding the bag. It's legalized looting."
b'Study after study shows that, past a certain point, a growing financial sector hurts the rest of the economy by extracting money from it. And America is way past that point.'

b'For decades, Washington has lived by a simple rule: If it\xe2\x80\x99s good for Wall Street, it\xe2\x80\x99s good for the economy. But it just isn\xe2\x80\x99t true. Big banks are making record profits and handing out huge bonuses as average wages barely budge.'

b'Wall Street is looting the economy\xe2\x80\x94and Washington is helping them do it. I\xe2\x80\x99m tired of big financial firms padding their own pockets while the rest of the economy suffers, and that\xe2\x80\x99s why I\xe2\x80\x99ve got a plan to end it: https://t.co/klbgd2nFgV'

b'We must call out those who remain silent. We must initiate impeachment proceedings to hold him accountable. And we must build an unstoppable grassroots movement that resoundingly defeats not just Trump, but complicit Republicans everywhere.'

b'This president is desperate. Calling out his racism, xenophobia, and misogyny is imperative. But he\xe2\x80\x99s trying to divide us and distract from his own crimes, and from his deeply unpopular agenda of letting the wealthy and well-connected rip off the country. We must do more.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ll work with Congress to pass broad-reaching reform, but I\xe2\x80\x99m also prepared to move forward with executive action if they refuse to act. We need big, structural change: A fair immigration system that preserves our security, grows our economy, and reflects our values.'

b'But we cannot fully address migration until we address its root causes\xe2\x80\x94poverty, climate change, violence and injustice. As president, I\xe2\x80\x99ll restore and increase aid and step up efforts to address transnational crime. And my administration will protect those seeking refuge here.'

b'I\xe2\x80\x99ll also work to expand legal immigration and take executive action to provide a measure of protection for our Dreamers and those who have built careers and families here, while pursuing a legislative solution that provides a fair and achievable path to citizenship.'

b'Our laws and our values compel us to help those fleeing violence and oppression. As president, I\xe2\x80\x99ll reject exclusionary policies based on race, religion and nationality, and I\xe2\x80\x99ll reverse Trump\xe2\x80\x99s bigoted Muslim Ban on my first day in office.'

b"To prevent future abuses of our immigration system, my administration will establish independent immigration courts. We'll eliminate expedited removal and provide due process for immigrants facing deportation, guaranteeing hearings and providing access to counsel."

b'Next, I\xe2\x80\x99ll significantly reduce immigration detention. Separating families and detaining the vulnerable is expensive, inhumane, and has no proven deterrent effect. I\xe2\x80\x99ll end unnecessary detention, detaining only those who pose a safety risk, and stop for-profit detention entirely.'

b"And my administration will demand accountability for the abuse committed under the Trump administration. I'll set up a DOJ task force to investigate accusations of serious violations and give it independent authority to pursue any criminal allegations."

b"Our immigration agencies should protect Americans and uphold the rule of law, not pursue punitive anti-immigrant policies that target communities of color. As president, I'll reshape CBP and ICE from top to bottom."

b'Entering the country without authorization has always been a violation of civil immigration law, but thanks to a former segregationist senator, it\xe2\x80\x99s also a criminal violation. This is totally unnecessary for border security, and we should repeal the criminal prohibition.'
b'My plan starts with eliminating abusive enforcement. Trump has weaponized deportation in ways that are costly, ineffective, and designed to maximize pain. As president, I will end this cruelty.'

b'Immigrants are our neighbors, our colleagues, and our friends\xe2\x80\x94and every bit as much a part of America as those who were born in the United States. Our immigration system must be fair, humane, and reflect our values. Our neighbors shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to live in fear.'

b"President Trump has taken our immigration system to its most punitive extreme, but his racist policies build on a broken system and an enforcement infrastructure already primed for abuse. Today, I'm announcing my plan to reform our immigration system. https://t.co/LPDEESENgY"

b"We need to take bold action to attack climate change. I'm proud to support the #GreenNewDeal. I've also got plans to invest in clean energy tech and to stop drilling and promote renewables on public lands. This plan is another tool we can use to attack climate change."

b'My Climate Risk Disclosure plan requires companies to publicly disclose both environmental & financial climate-related risks to their business. Investors are already divesting from fossil fuel companies, and this will push more investors to divest and transition to clean energy.'

b"Black women are more likely to be breadwinners for their families, yet they are paid less and are less likely to be able to afford health care, child care, and housing. I'm proud to share my new plan to address this head on at #EssenceFest this weekend: https://t.co/COUKtCr5NF"

b'This is just the first step\xe2\x80\x94but it\xe2\x80\x99s a necessary one. It\xe2\x80\x99s time to build an America that recognizes the role that women of color play in their families and in the economy, that fairly values their work, and that delivers equal opportunity for everyone.'

b'Finally, I will strengthen enforcement against systemic discrimination. I will direct federal agencies to target enforcement towards industries where we know women of color face higher rates of discrimination.'

b'I will also make sure the senior ranks of the federal government look like America. My administration will ensure that federal agencies recruit women of color and develop leadership paths for them. The government should do better if it demands more from the private sector.'

b'First, I will have new requirements for federal contractors: companies with bad track records on equal pay and management diversity won\xe2\x80\x99t get new contracts. No contractor will be permitted to use forced arbitration and non-compete clauses for low- and medium-wage workers.'

b"The government has helped perpetuate the systemic discrimination that has denied women of color equal opportunities, and it\xe2\x80\x99s time to right those wrongs. I've got a plan to boost their wages, open up career advancement, and fight systemic discrimination."

b'The gender pay gap hits women of color particularly hard. When future employers use salary history to make new offers, they trap women of color in lower wages. Black and Brown women are disproportionately mistreated at work. Their path to higher-level management jobs is rockier.'

b'Women of color face a steeper climb to provide financial security for their families because of systemic discrimination. On Day One of a Warren administration, I\xe2\x80\x99ll take a series of executive actions to help boost their wages and leadership opportunities. https://t.co/qpzW3XDjT4'

b'I don\xe2\x80\x99t spend my time at fancy closed-door fundraisers trading favors for money, and I\xe2\x80\x99ll appoint only the most qualified person for the job. In a Warren administration, I pledge not to give ambassadorial posts to wealthy donors or bundlers. Period.'

b"Trump has perfected the act of selling swanky diplomatic posts to rich buffoons. He's appointed political cronies to nearly half the available ambassadorial positions. He may think a fat wallet and a big campaign check qualifies someone to represent our country abroad. I don't."

b'To do this, we need to recruit a new generation of foreign service officers and retain talented officers. I\xe2\x80\x99ll also significantly expand the pool of diplomatic talent. Today\xe2\x80\x99s foreign service is 79% white and 65% male. Our foreign service must reflect the diversity of the U.S.'

b'Our foreign policy should not be run out of the Pentagon. Under a Warren administration, it won\xe2\x80\x99t be. So I\xe2\x80\x99ll start by doubling the size of the foreign service and opening new diplomatic posts in underserved areas to broaden U.S. diplomatic presence.'

b'The Pentagon is nearly 40 times bigger than the State Department\xe2\x80\x94we employ more people in military grocery stores than we do foreign service officers. Our underinvestment in diplomacy causes our leaders to default to military action, instead of treating it as a last resort.'

b"Senior career officials at the State Department have been pushed out & others have resigned in protest. We've lost 60% of our career ambassadors & 20% of our most experienced civil servants. Too often they've been replaced with totally unqualified campaign donors & Trump cronies."

b'To take a meaningful leadership position in the world, protect our interests, and avoid conflicts, we need world-class diplomats. But through a toxic combination of malice and neglect, Donald Trump has declared war on the State Department.'

b"The practice of auctioning off American diplomacy to the highest bidder must end. I'm pledging to end the corrupt practice of selling cushy diplomatic posts to wealthy donors\xe2\x80\x94and I call on everyone running for President to do the same. Read my full plan: https://t.co/Bd6E6g8bYX"

b'The Census must count every person. Our Constitution demands it. Our democracy requires it. And I hope that the courts will continue to keep this racist and blatantly partisan question off of the 2020 Census.'

b".@NALEO's \xc2\xa1H\xc3\xa1gase Contar! Census 2020 Campaign is already working to ensure that immigrant and Latinx communities are fully counted, and I join them in calling on these communities to be heard."

b"Finally, we'd ban the use of citizenship questions in government surveys and implement lasting reforms to the Census to prevent any president from using these kinds of tricks to take political representation or other resources away from immigrant communities."

b"Next, my administration would conduct a second Census\xe2\x80\x94without any questions about citizenship\xe2\x80\x94to replace Trump's tainted Census in advance of the 2022 midterm elections. And I would have an aggressive, well-funded outreach campaign to reach historically undercounted communities."

b"Here's how this would work. First, I would immediately direct all executive agencies to ignore the tainted Census data until a new Census is complete. States receive nearly $600 billion per year from 16 programs tied to Census data, & we won't allow a tainted Census to skew that."

b"If the Trump admin somehow manages to get that question back on the Census, I will cancel that rigged Census and replace it with a fair and accurate one. And I'll make this promise right now: A Warren administration would never include a citizenship question on the Census."

b"The Supreme Court's ruling blocking the citizenship question on the 2020 Census is a welcome relief\xe2\x80\x94but the Court has left open the possibility that the Trump administration could still add a citizenship question to the Census. And if they do, I have a plan for that."

b"Washington hands billions to corporations profiting off of inhumane detention and incarceration policies while ignoring the families that are destroyed. It's corruption, plain and simple. Incarcerating and detaining millions for profit doesn\xe2\x80\x99t keep us safe. We must do better."

b"Finally, I'll hold contractors accountable by expanding oversight, transparency and enforcement. It\xe2\x80\x99s time to shine sunlight on the black box of private services that receive taxpayer dollars."

b"First, I'll end all contracts between the Bureau of Prisons, ICE, and the U.S. Marshals Service and private detention providers. There should be no place in America for profiting off of putting more people behind bars or in detention."

b'Our criminal and immigration systems are tearing apart communities of color and devastating the poor, including children. Women\xe2\x80\x94especially women of color\xe2\x80\x94are particularly saddled with the financial burden.'

b'And the exploitation doesn\xe2\x80\x99t end when people leave these facilities. For-profit supervision companies (which are often run by the same private prison corporations) get rich by charging outrageous fees for monitoring and supervision services like ankle monitors.'

b'The companies running prisons and detention centers regularly sacrifice safety to boost their bottom line. Private contractors in both public and private centers regularly cut corners to maximize margins and come up with schemes to make millions off of incarcerated people.'

b'The private prison population has grown rapidly since 2000. And with Donald Trump in the White House, private prison companies saw an opportunity to make millions off of his cruel immigration policies. Today, 73% of detained immigrants are held in private detention facilities.'

b'Private prison companies have spent millions to turn our criminal and immigration policies into ones that prioritize making them rich instead of keeping us safe\xe2\x80\x94with terrible consequences. Today I\xe2\x80\x99m announcing my plan to end this private profiteering off of cruelty.'

b'I pledge to nominate an Office of Legal Counsel head who will reverse the Watergate-era rule that a president cannot be indicted for criminal behavior. The OLC\xe2\x80\x99s purpose is to govern the conduct of the executive branch, not act as the president\xe2\x80\x99s get-out-of-jail-free card.'

b'Attorney General Bill Barr has disgraced himself by acting like Trump\xe2\x80\x99s personal defense attorney. When I\xe2\x80\x99m elected, I will appoint an Attorney General who shares my strong conviction that no one\xe2\x80\x94not even a president\xe2\x80\x94is above the law. And I\xe2\x80\x99ll go one step further:'

b"One of the strongest arguments against indictment is that the Constitution gives Congress the sole authority to decide when to interfere with the President's duties. These new laws would eliminate that argument and remove any statutory ambiguity."

b'Congress should pass a law clarifying that DOJ can indict the president if he or she commits a crime in office, and should amend our obstruction of justice statutes to explicitly allow for indictment when the President abuses the powers of the office\xe2\x80\x94like Donald Trump did.'

b'No president should be above the law. So why does this Justice Department act like he is? Because in the 1970s Richard Nixon\xe2\x80\x99s Justice Department wrote a memo saying so (yes, really) and DOJ has continued to stand by that view.'

b'The Mueller report is a clear roadmap for impeachment, because that\xe2\x80\x99s the only path Mueller had. But impeachment shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be the only way that a president can be held accountable for committing a crime.'

b'The Mueller report details crimes by the president that would lead to the indictment of any other citizen. But Mueller couldn\xe2\x80\x99t bring charges because a Justice Department policy says you can\xe2\x80\x99t charge a sitting president. That policy is wrong and needs to go. Here\xe2\x80\x99s how and why.'

b'Access to safe, legal abortion is a constitutional right and Congress can act to protect it. We\xe2\x80\x99re going to fight every right-wing lawmaker\xe2\x80\x99s attempt to overturn Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/1s11vyuGa4'

b'Sixty-five years ago today, SCOTUS decided on the landmark Brown v. Board of Education: Hateful school segregation laws are unconstitutional. It was an important ruling, but it didn\xe2\x80\x99t end systemic racism in our country. We need to keep calling out racism every chance we get.'

b"When I was growing up, people still got abortions. Some were lucky\xe2\x80\x94others weren't. They all went through hell. The overwhelming majority of Americans don\xe2\x80\x99t want to return to that time. Congress should act to ensure that the will of the people remains the law of the land."

b'And the women of color who have led the repro justice movement teach us that these issues are bigger than Roe. We must go beyond abortion to ensure access to contraception, STI prevention & care, sex ed, care for pregnant moms, safe home & work environments, good wages, & more.'

b'Finally, we must ensure equal access to health care and support reproductive justice. Systemic barriers have made it especially difficult for low-income women and women of color to get the access to reproductive care they need.'

b'Congress must guarantee reproductive health coverage as part of all health coverage. That starts with repealing the Hyde Amendment. Congress must also pass the EACH Woman Act, which would also prohibit abortion restrictions on private insurance.'

b'Next, Congress should pass federal laws to preempt state efforts to pass Targeted Regulations on Abortion Providers (TRAP) laws, which are designed to functionally limit and eliminate women\xe2\x80\x99s access to abortion care with medically-unnecessary restrictions.'

b"Popular new federal rights that parallel Roe would preempt state laws like the AL, GA, & OH bans. They'd end the political games played by right-wing courts to narrow Roe\xe2\x80\x99s protections. And they'd ensure that choice remains the law\xe2\x80\x94even if the Supreme Court overturns Roe."

b'First, Congress should create federal, statutory rights that parallel Roe\xe2\x80\x99s protections. We must prohibit states from interfering in the ability of a health professional to provide medical care\xe2\x80\x94including abortion care\xe2\x80\x94& from interfering in the ability of a patient to access care.'

b'We should pass new federal laws that protect access to reproductive care from right-wing ideologues in the states and ensure access to birth control and abortion care. Laws that will stand no matter what the Supreme Court does. Here\xe2\x80\x99s what that looks like: https://t.co/iBzvjDBCL4'

b'Our next President can begin to undo some of the damage by appointing neutral and fair judges who actually respect the law and cases like Roe instead of right-wing ideologues bent on rolling back our rights. But Congress has a role to play as well.'

b'They\xe2\x80\x99re hoping the Supreme Court will back their radical play, and it might work. Donald Trump packed the courts with extreme, anti-choice judges. Senate Republicans stole a SCOTUS seat & rammed through Justice Kavanaugh\xe2\x80\x99s confirmation in order to cement an anti-choice majority.'

b'These giant contractors have deployed an extremely profitable strategy: First, recruit armies of lobbyists from former Pentagon officials and congressional staffers. Then, get those former officials to use their relationships, access, and influence to secure lucrative contracts.'

b'I won\xe2\x80\x99t do a town hall with Fox News because I won\xe2\x80\x99t invite millions of Democratic primary voters to tune in, inflate ratings, and help sell ads for an outlet that profits from racism and hate. If you agree, sign our petition. https://t.co/zAyBN7i8Jf'

b'My mother didn\xe2\x80\x99t have much, but she knew that her kids had a fighting chance to build a future. Today, not every family has that fighting chance. That\xe2\x80\x99s what I\xe2\x80\x99m fighting for to honor my mother, on Mother\xe2\x80\x99s Day and every day. https://t.co/DUi5ZcVI0h'

b"For a long time, I thought that was just a story about my mother. And then years later, I came to understand that it's a story about millions of Americans who\xe2\x80\x94no matter how scared they are\xe2\x80\x94reach down, dig deep, find it, and pull up what they need to take care of the family."

b'I watched her while she pulled it together, put that dress on, put on her high heels, blew her nose, walked to Sears, and got a minimum wage job. And that minimum wage job saved our house, but more importantly, it saved our family. That story is written on my heart.'

b'Here\xe2\x80\x99s the truth: Fueling addiction is big business. The five companies being sued by Kermit earned $17 billion shipping prescription opioids to West Virginia during those few years, and their CEOs took home millions in bonuses and pay.'

b'This small but mighty town filed a lawsuit against the pharmacy and five of the wholesale drug distributors who exacerbated the crisis. And it\xe2\x80\x99s just one of many similar lawsuits lodged by towns, counties, and states across the country.'

b'The companies shipping these pills repeatedly disregarded requirements to report suspicious patterns of behavior, and the state Board of Pharmacy failed to enforce its own rules. But Kermit is fighting back.'

b'Over a period of just a few years, this town of only 400 people was flooded with approximately 13 million prescription opioid pills\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x8athat\xe2\x80\x99s more than 30,000 pills per resident\xe2\x80\x94all delivered to a single local pharmacy\xe2\x80\x8a.'

b'Sin embargo, por causa de su estatus \xc3\xbanico, esas avenidas legales no est\xc3\xa1n a su alcance. Gran parte de la deuda est\xc3\xa1 en manos de Wall Street, quienes intentan exprimir hasta el \xc3\xbaltimo centavo de ganancia.'

b'Si Puerto Rico fuera una corporaci\xc3\xb3n grande o una ciudad en los Estados Unidos en este tipo de crisis financiera, podr\xc3\xada declararse en bancarrota: pagando parte de su deuda, liquidando el resto y as\xc3\xad comenzar a reconstruir.'

b"Much of Puerto Rico\xe2\x80\x99s debt is held by Wall Street, which is trying to squeeze out every last penny of profit. Congress had a chance to break Wall Street's grip. Instead, they passed PROMESA, imposing an oversight board which has slashed services, hindering the recovery."

b'If Puerto Rico were a big company or an American city in this kind of financial trouble, it could file for bankruptcy, pay some of its debts, discharge the rest, then start rebuilding. But because of its unique status, those legal options aren\xe2\x80\x99t available.'
